analysis: The documents all pertain to extending trust periods on land allotments made to Native American tribes and individuals. The extensions are for varying periods (10 or 25 years) and apply to different reservations and tribes across the United States. The documents cite the authority of specific acts of Congress related to land allotments and trust periods. Some orders include exceptions or stipulations regarding the application of the extensions.
title: Land Allotment Trust Period Extensions for Native American Tribes
